result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Chris Weiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. Pay supervision fees. Court set restitution at zero.

No contact with firearms.
Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless the agent contacts the court and the court approves it.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

AODA assessment; comply with treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Chris Weiss

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Chris Weiss in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing proceeded...
.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

As to count 1:
  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless the agent contacts the court and the court approves it.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Chris Weiss in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is requesting a plea and sentencing date in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Chris Weiss NOT in court with attorney Francisco Araiza previously in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at 1:30 PM. Case set for pretrial conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit forfeited, pending restitution and recompense.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anthony Chris Weiss in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Anthony Chris Weiss in custody.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
